A hands-on guide to grasping the moon's schedule on this special Friday, October 10, 2025.
The moon on Karwa Chauth often rises late, guided by a cosmic rhythm. This timing isn't random; it's shaped by the moon's orbit, its position, and Earth's location.
Karwa Chauth occurs on the fourth day (Chaturthi) of the moon's waning phase (Krishna Paksha), with the moon rising later in the evening, just four days after the full moon.
The moon rises about 50 minutes later daily, and by the fourth day of waning, this delay becomes notable, making moonrise much later than on full moon night.
Your location's latitude and longitude dictate when the moon rises, causing times to vary between cities.
